messages.message: Linearizes spectra so that each energy channel has the same width.
Truncates the energy range of the spectrum by discarding data channels.
Combines energy channels together so spectrum will have less data channels
Converts the energy calibration type to Full Range Fraction
Converts the energy calibration type to Polynomial.

Allows using multiple spectra with peaks fit, from one or more spectrum files, to perform an energy calibration. Can especially be useful for lower-resolution detectors where each spectrum has a different test source

Download a .CALp file that contains the current energy calibration. You can drag-n-drop this file back onto InterSpec later to re-use this energy calibration. This is especially useful if you often use data from a detector whose calibration needs to be consistently adjusted.
You can apply this CALp file later to a different spectrum by dragging and dropping the CALp file onto InterSpec.

Uses the expected energy of photopeaks associated with the fit peaks to fit for the energy coefficients. This button is disabled if no coefficients are selected to fit for, or less peaks than coefficients are selected.
Calibration change not applicable to any detector of {1}
Calibration change not applicable to any samples of {1}
The number of new calibration channels ({1}) doesn't match old calibration ({2}).
The CALp file is missing calibration for detectors: {1}.{2}
There were extra calibrations for non-existent detectors: {1}.
All calibrations in CALp file specify a detector name, but current spectrum detector is unnamed.
Couldn't identify previous calibration to use for detector '{1}'.
The number of new calibration channels ({1}) doesn't match old calibration ({2}) for detector '{3}'.

message.p: Select the CALp file to use
Note: you can also drag-n-drop CALp files onto InterSpec

messages.message: Calibration change made a energy calibration become invalid{1}. Error: {2}
Sample {1}, Detector '{2}' has {3} channels but calibration being set has {4}.
Adding deviation pair made energy calibration become invalid{1}. Error: {2}
Unexpected error retrieving previous calibration coefficients - not applying changes
It looks like the energy calibration you changed isn't marked for changes to be applied to; please correct that.
Changing the deviation pair made energy calibration become invalid. Error: {1}
There was an error setting deviation pairs for this detector.
Deviation pairs applied only to the '{1}' detector, but to all sample numbers{2}.
Deviation pairs applied to all sample numbers{1}.
Can not fit calibration coefficients right now. You must select at least as many peaks for fitting as coefficients you have selected to fit for.
Please select calibration of a displayed detector
Not enough channels in the data.
You must select at least one coefficient to fit for.
ErrorMsg Failed to fit energy calibration using both matrix and iterative approaches
Energy calibration has been updated from fitting.
Failed calibration by fitting peak means. {1}
If you recalibrate again by ALT+CTRL+DRAG on another portion of the spectrum, you will be given the option of preserving the effects of this calibration as well.
